thread.title: Lucedale man faces trial over sawed-off shotgun
thread.title_full: Lucedale man faces trial over sawed-off shotgun - FOX 8 WVUE New Orleans News, Weather, Sports, Social

author: cbs8
title: Lucedale man faces trial over sawed-off shotgun
text:
GULFPORT, Miss. (AP) - GULFPORT -- A 45-year-old Lucedale man has pleaded not guilty on a federal charge alleging he was in possession of an illegal sawed-off shotgun.
The Sun Herald reports ( http://bit.ly/1NnU4Je ) James Denson Tanner is accused of having the modified weapon Oct. 1, 2014, in George County.
A federal grand jury indicted him on a charge of possession of an unregistered firearm in April. Maximum penalties are 10 years in prison and a $250,000 fine.
Tanner made his first court appearance Oct. 9 in U.S. District Court. Magistrate Judge John Gargiulo set a $25,000 bond and ordered Tanner to remove any other firearms from his home.
His trial is set on a court calendar that starts Jan. 4.
Sawed-off shotguns are easy to conceal and are considered a deadly close-range weapon.
Information from: The Sun Herald, http://www.sunherald.com
